metadata.title: Debian 9 is installed
metadata.description: Debian 9 (Stretch) is installed

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded Libraries component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take control of the system.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded Hotspot component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take control of the system.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, JRockit Serialization component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Networking component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause no confidentiality impact, low integrity impact, and no availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded Libraries component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded JAXP component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded JAX-WS component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Serialization component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded RMI component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to take control of the system.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Serialization component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded Serialization component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE Deployment component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause low confidentiality impact, low integrity impact, and low availability impact.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Security component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to obtain sensitive information resulting in a high confidentiality impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: An unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE related to the Java SE, Java SE Embedded, JRockit Networking component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial of service resulting in a low availability impact using unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in IBM Java SDK affect AIX
metadata.description: Little CMS is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an out-of-bounds read in Type_MLU_Read function in cmstypes.c. By using a specially-crafted image, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash or obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: DSA-4075-1 -- thunderbird -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Thunderbird, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, denial of service, information disclosure or spoofing of sender's email addresses.

metadata.title: DSA-4076-1 -- asterisk -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Asterisk, an open source PBX and telephony toolkit, which may result in denial of service, information disclosure and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4081-1 -- php5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a widely-used open source general purpose scripting language.

metadata.title: DSA-4079-1 -- poppler -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the poppler PDF rendering library, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed PDF file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4077-1 -- gimp -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in GIMP, the GNU Image Manipulation Program, which could result in denial of service (application crash) or potentially the execution of arbitrary code if malformed files are opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4078-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple researchers have discovered a vulnerability in Intel processors, enabling an attacker controlling an unprivileged process to read memory from arbitrary addresses, including from the kernel and all other processes running on the system.

metadata.title: DSA-4080-1 -- php7.0 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, a widely-used open source general purpose scripting language.

metadata.title: DSA-4082-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Linux Kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leaks.

metadata.title: DSA-4083-1 -- poco -- security update
metadata.description: Stephan Zeisberg discovered that poco, a collection of open source C++ class libraries, did not correctly validate file paths in ZIP archives. An attacker could leverage this flaw to create or overwrite arbitrary files.

metadata.title: DSA-4086-1 -- libxml2 -- security update
metadata.description: Nick Wellnhofer discovered that certain function calls inside XPath predicates can lead to use-after-free and double-free errors when executed by libxml2's XPath engine via an XSLT transformation.

metadata.title: DSA-4092-1 -- awstats -- security update
metadata.description: The cPanel Security Team discovered that awstats, a log file analyzer, was vulnerable to path traversal attacks. A remote unauthenticated attacker could leverage that to perform arbitrary code execution.

metadata.title: DSA-4090-1 -- wordpress -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Wordpress, a web blogging tool.

metadata.title: DSA-4087-1 -- transmission -- security update
metadata.description: Tavis Ormandy discovered a vulnerability in the Transmission BitTorrent client; insecure RPC handling between the Transmission daemon and the client interface(s) may result in the execution of arbitrary code if a user visits a malicious website while Transmission is running.

metadata.title: DSA-4089-1 -- bind9 -- security update
metadata.description: Jayachandran Palanisamy of Cygate AB reported that BIND, a DNS server implementation, was improperly sequencing cleanup operations, leading in some cases to a use-after-free error, triggering an assertion failure and crash in named.

metadata.title: DSA-4091-1 -- mysql-5.5 -- security update
metadata.description: Several issues have been discovered in the MySQL database server.

metadata.title: DSA-4085-1 -- xmltooling -- security update
metadata.description: Philip Huppert discovered the Shibboleth service provider is vulnerable to impersonation attacks and information disclosure due to mishandling of DTDs in the XMLTooling XML parsing library.

metadata.title: DSA-4088-1 -- gdk-pixbuf -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that multiple integer overflows in the GIF image loader in the GDK Pixbuf library may result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed image file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4084-1 -- gifsicle -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that gifsicle, a tool for manipulating GIF image files, contained a flaw that could lead to arbitrary code execution.

metadata.title: Critical Patch Update January 2018
metadata.description: Critical Patch Update January 2018

metadata.title: Meltdown vulnerability
metadata.description: IBM has released AIX and VIOS iFixes in response to the vulnerabilities known as Spectre and Meltdown

metadata.title: Spectre vulnerability
metadata.description: IBM has released AIX and VIOS iFixes in response to the vulnerabilities known as Spectre and Meltdown

metadata.title: Critical Patch Update January 2018
metadata.description: Critical Patch Update January 2018

metadata.title: Spectre vulnerability
metadata.description: IBM has released AIX and VIOS iFixes in response to the vulnerabilities known as Spectre and Meltdown

metadata.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in OpenSSL affects AIX
metadata.description: OpenSSL could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a flaw in the "error state" mechanism when directly calling SSL_read() or SSL_write() for an SSL object after receiving a fatal error. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass the decryption or encryption process and perform unauthorized actions

metadata.title: DSA-4104-1 -- p7zip -- security update
metadata.description: 'landave' discovered a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the NCompress::NShrink::CDecoder::CodeReal method in p7zip, a 7zr file archiver with high compression ratio.

metadata.title: DSA-4100-1 -- tiff -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the libtiff library and the included tools, which may result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4094-1 -- smarty3 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that Smarty, a PHP template engine, was vulnerable to code-injection attacks. An attacker was able to craft a filename in comments that could lead to arbitrary code execution on the host running Smarty.

metadata.title: DSA-4103-1 -- chromium-browser -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the chromium web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4096-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been found in the Mozilla Firefox web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4097-1 -- poppler -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in the poppler PDF rendering library, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed PDF file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4101-1 -- wireshark -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that wireshark, a network protocol analyzer, contained several vulnerabilities in the dissectors/file parsers for IxVeriWave, WCP, JSON, XML, NTP, XMPP and GDB, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4098-1 -- curl -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in cURL, an URL transfer library.

metadata.title: DSA-4099-1 -- ffmpeg -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the FFmpeg multimedia framework, which could result in denial of service or potentially the execution of arbitrary code if malformed files/streams are processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4093-1 -- openocd -- security update
metadata.description: Josef Gajdusek discovered that OpenOCD, a JTAG debugger for ARM and MIPS, was vulnerable to Cross Protocol Scripting attacks. An attacker could craft a HTML page that, when visited by a victim running OpenOCD, could execute arbitrary commands on the victims host.

metadata.title: DSA-4102-1 -- thunderbird -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Thunderbird, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, denial of service or URL spoofing.

metadata.title: DSA-4095-1 -- gcab -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that gcab, a Microsoft Cabinet file manipulation tool, is prone to a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability when extracting .cab files.

metadata.title: DSA-4110-1 -- exim4 -- security update
metadata.description: Meh Chang discovered a buffer overflow flaw in a utility function used in the SMTP listener of Exim, a mail transport agent.

metadata.title: DSA-4108-1 -- mailman -- security update
metadata.description: Calum Hutton and the Mailman team discovered a cross site scripting and information leak vulnerability in the user options page.

metadata.title: DSA-4114-1 -- jackson-databind -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that jackson-databind, a Java library used to parse JSON and other data formats, did not properly validate user input before attempting deserialization.

metadata.title: DSA-4111-1 -- libreoffice -- security update
metadata.description: Mikhail Klementev, Ronnie Goodrich and Andrew Krasichkov discovered that missing restrictions in the implementation of the WEBSERVICE function in LibreOffice could result in the disclosure of arbitrary files readable by the user who opens a malformed document.

metadata.title: DSA-4113-1 -- libvorbis -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in the libraries of the Vorbis audio compression codec, which could result in denial of service or the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed media file is processed.

metadata.title: DSA-4105-1 -- mpv -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that mpv, a media player, was vulnerable to remote code execution attacks. An attacker could craft a malicious web page that, when used as an argument in mpv, could execute arbitrary code in the host of the mpv user.

metadata.title: DSA-4109-1 -- ruby-omniauth -- security update
metadata.description: Lalith Rallabhandi discovered that OmniAuth, a Ruby library for implementing multi-provider authentication in web applications, mishandled and leaked sensitive information.

metadata.title: DSA-4106-1 -- libtasn1-6 -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in Libtasn1, a library to manage ASN.1 structures, allowing a remote attacker to cause a denial of service against an application using the Libtasn1 library.

metadata.title: DSA-4107-1 -- django-anymail -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that the webhook validation of Anymail, a Django email backends for multiple ESPs, is prone to a timing attack. A remote attacker can take advantage of this flaw to obtain a WEBHOOK_AUTHORIZATION secret and post arbitrary email tracking events.

metadata.title: DSA-4112-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Xen hypervisor.

metadata.title: DSA-4115-1 -- quagga -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Quagga, a routing daemon.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: A software logic bug creates a vulnerability in an AIX 6.1, 7.1, and 7.2 daemon which could allow a user with root privileges on one system, to obtain root access on another machine.

metadata.title: DSA-4117-1 -- gcc-4.9 -- security update
metadata.description: This update doesn't fix a vulnerability in GCC itself, but instead provides support for building retpoline-enabled Linux kernel updates.

metadata.title: DSA-4124-1 -- lucene-solr -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities have been found in Solr, a search server based on Lucene, which could result in the execution of arbitrary code or path traversal.

metadata.title: DSA-4116-1 -- plasma-workspace -- security update
metadata.description: Krzysztof Sieluzycki discovered that the notifier for removable devices in the KDE Plasma workspace performed insufficient sanitisation of FAT/VFAT volume labels, which could result in the execution of arbitrary shell commands if a removable device with a malformed disk label is mounted.

metadata.title: DSA-4118-1 -- tomcat-native -- security update
metadata.description: Jonas Klempel reported that tomcat-native, a library giving Tomcat access to the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library's network connection (socket) implementation and random-number generator, does not properly handle fields longer than 127 bytes when parsing the AIA-Extension field of a client certificate. If OCSP checks are used, this could result in client certificates that should have been rejected to be accepted.

metadata.title: DSA-4125-1 -- wavpack -- security update
metadata.description: Joonun Jang discovered several problems in wavpack, an audio compression format suite.

metadata.title: DSA-4126-1 -- xmltooling -- security update
metadata.description: Kelby Ludwig and Scott Cantor discovered that the Shibboleth service provider is vulnerable to impersonation attacks and information disclosure due to incorrect XML parsing.

metadata.title: DSA-4123-1 -- drupal7 -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in the Drupal content management framework.

metadata.title: DSA-4122-1 -- squid3 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Squid3, a fully featured web proxy cache.

metadata.title: DSA-4119-1 -- libav -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been corrected in multiple demuxers and decoders of the libav multimedia library.

metadata.title: DSA-4121-1 -- gcc-6 -- security update
metadata.description: This update doesn't fix a vulnerability in GCC itself, but instead provides support for building retpoline-enabled Linux kernel updates.

metadata.title: DSA-4120-1 -- linux -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Linux kernel that may lead to a privilege escalation, denial of service or information leaks.

metadata.title: DSA-4137-1 -- libvirt -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Libvirt, a virtualisation abstraction library.

metadata.title: DSA-4133-1 -- isc-dhcp -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the ISC DHCP client, relay and server.

metadata.title: DSA-4130-1 -- dovecot -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Dovecot email server.

metadata.title: DSA-4129-1 -- freexl -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple heap buffer over reads were discovered in freexl, a library to read Microsoft Excel spreadsheets, which could result in denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-4134-1 -- util-linux -- security update
metadata.description: Bjorn Bosselmann discovered that the umount bash completion from util-linux does not properly handle embedded shell commands in a mountpoint name. An attacker with rights to mount filesystems can take advantage of this flaw for privilege escalation if a user (in particular root) is tricked into using the umount completion while a specially crafted mount is present.

metadata.title: DSA-4138-1 -- mbedtls -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in mbed TLS, a lightweight crypto and SSL/TLS library, that allowed a remote attacker to either cause a denial-of-service by application crash, or execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4127-1 -- simplesamlphp -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in SimpleSAMLphp, a framework for authentication, primarily via the SAML protocol.

metadata.title: DSA-4131-1 -- xen -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Xen hypervisor.

metadata.title: DSA-4128-1 -- trafficserver -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in Apache Traffic Server, a reverse and forward proxy server. They could lead to the use of an incorrect upstream proxy, or allow a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-service by application crash.

metadata.title: DSA-4135-1 -- samba -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Samba, a SMB/CIFS file, print, and login server for Unix.

metadata.title: DSA-4136-1 -- curl -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in cURL, an URL transfer library.

metadata.title: DSA-4132-1 -- libvpx -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that incorrect validation of frame widths in the libvpx multimedia library may result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4145-1 -- gitlab -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in Gitlab, a software platform to collaborate on code.

metadata.title: DSA-4140-1 -- libvorbis -- security update
metadata.description: Richard Zhu discovered that an out-of-bounds memory write in the codebook parsing code of the Libvorbis multimedia library could result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed Vorbis file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4144-1 -- openjdk-8 -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenJDK, an implementation of the Oracle Java platform, resulting in denial of service, sandbox bypass, execution of arbitrary code, incorrect LDAP/GSS authentication, insecure use of cryptography or bypass of deserialisation restrictions.

metadata.title: DSA-4139-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Several security issues have been found in the Mozilla Firefox web browser.

metadata.title: DSA-4143-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: Richard Zhu and Huzaifa Sidhpurwala discovered that an out-of-bounds memory write when playing Vorbis media files could result in the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4147-1 -- polarssl -- security update
metadata.description: Several vulnerabilities were discovered in PolarSSL, a lightweight crypto and SSL/TLS library, that allowed a remote attacker to either cause a denial-of-service by application crash, or execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4146-1 -- plexus-utils -- security update
metadata.description: Charles Duffy discovered that the Commandline class in the utilities for the Plexus framework performs insufficient quoting of double-encoded strings, which could result in the execution of arbitrary shell commands.

metadata.title: DSA-4142-1 -- uwsgi -- security update
metadata.description: Marios Nicolaides discovered that the PHP plugin in uWSGI, a fast, self-healing application container server, does not properly handle a DOCUMENT_ROOT check during use of the --php-docroot option, allowing a remote attacker to mount a directory traversal attack and gain unauthorized read access to sensitive files located outside of the web root directory.

metadata.title: DSA-4141-1 -- libvorbisidec -- security update
metadata.description: Huzaifa Sidhpurwala discovered that an out-of-bounds memory write in the codebook parsing code of the Libtremor multimedia library could result in the execution of arbitrary code if a malformed Vorbis file is opened.

metadata.title: DSA-4158-1 -- openssl1.0 -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that constructed ASN.1 types with a recursive definition could exceed the stack, potentially leading to a denial of service.

metadata.title: DSA-4151-1 -- librelp -- security update
metadata.description: Bas van Schaik and Kevin Backhouse discovered a stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in librelp, a library providing reliable event logging over the network, triggered while checking x509 certificates from a peer.

metadata.title: DSA-4155-1 -- thunderbird -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple security issues have been found in Thunderbird, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code, denial of service or information disclosure.

metadata.title: DSA-4152-1 -- mupdf -- security update
metadata.description: Two vulnerabilities were discovered in MuPDF, a PDF, XPS, and e-book viewer, which may result in denial of service or remote code execution.

metadata.title: DSA-4157-1 -- openssl -- security update
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL, a Secure Sockets Layer toolkit.

metadata.title: DSA-4149-1 -- plexus-utils2 -- security update
metadata.description: Charles Duffy discovered that the Commandline class in the utilities for the Plexus framework performs insufficient quoting of double-encoded strings, which could result in the execution of arbitrary shell commands.

metadata.title: DSA-4153-1 -- firefox-esr -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that a use-after-free in the compositor of Firefox can result in the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4156-1 -- drupal7 -- security update
metadata.description: A remote code execution vulnerability has been found in Drupal, a fully-featured content management framework.

metadata.title: DSA-4150-1 -- icu -- security update
metadata.description: It was discovered that an integer overflow in the International Components for Unicode (ICU) library could result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4148-1 -- kamailio -- security update
metadata.description: Alfred Farrugia and Sandro Gauci discovered an off-by-one heap overflow in the Kamailio SIP server which could result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

metadata.title: DSA-4154-1 -- net-snmp -- security update
metadata.description: A heap corruption vulnerability was discovered in net-snmp, a suite of Simple Network Management Protocol applications, triggered when parsing the PDU prior to the authentication process.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the VQP component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the DHCPv6 component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the MPTCP component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the CFM component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a heap-based buffer over-read in the pimv1_print function in print-pim.c. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the Zephyr component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the IEEE 802.11 component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the ISO IS-IS component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a heap-based buffer over-read in the lldp_print function in print-lldp.c. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the ISAKMP component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the LLDP component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the RSVP component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the SMB/CIFS component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the ICMP component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the RESP component. By sending specially crafted data, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to enter into an infinite loop.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the NFS component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the IPv6 mobility component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a heap-based buffer over-read in the pimv1_print function in print-pim.c. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a buffer overread memory in the lookup_bytestring component. By sending a specially crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the LLDP component. By sending specially crafted data, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to enter into an infinite loop.

metadata.title: Vulnerability impacts AIX
metadata.description: tcpdump is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the bittok2str_internal component. By sending an overly long string argument, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.
